description:
This is the third part of an introductory business information systems series, designed to help you pass the CLEP Information Systems and Computer Applications exam and introduce you to the amazing world of Information Technology.

In this course, you will learn the basic concepts of information systems and their application. ​By completing this 5 course XSeries, you will be prepared to pass the CLEP Information Systems and Computer Applications exam.

In Part 3, you will learn:

Software development methods and tools
	Systems development life cycle concepts
	Project management functions and roles
	Types of information processing methods (batch, real-time, transaction)
	User interface design
	Development and purpose of standards
requirements:
Basic understanding of internet and computers.
Knowledge of arithmetic and mathematics of a traditional first-year high school algebra course is assumed.
